snippet: If Mitt Romney succeeds in South Carolina, a place famous for surfacing the dark undercurrents of American politics, it will be a triumph of political rebranding.
abstract: News analysis on the tests Mitt Romney will face in South Carolina in order to win the Republican presidential primary in that state; holds that he has the opportunity to show he can overcome doubts among evangelicals and Tea Party adherents about his ideological commitment, and assume leadership of a party that has spent the last two years under the sway of a conservative insurgency; asserts that if Romney succeeds, it will be a triumph of political rebranding.

byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: If Mitt Romney succeeds in South Carolina, a place famous for surfacing the dark undercurrents of American politics, it will be a triumph of political rebranding.

headline.seo: News Analysis: For Romney, Challenges Await on Ideology and Faith
headline.main: In South Carolina, Challenges Await on Ideology and Faith
headline.print_headline: In South Carolina, Challenges Await on Ideology and Faith
headline.sub: No Opponents Drop Out as Race Moves to South Carolina

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
